resources.string: This app can read and write NFC-compatible RFID Tags for the TonUINO DIY music box.
More information about the TonUINO project is available at https://www.voss.earth/tonuino and https://discourse.voss.earth (mostly German).
This device does not support NFC. The functionality is not available.
"NFC is available, but currently deactivated.\nPlease enable NFC in the device settings."
If this device is placed on a supported NFC-compatible RFID tag, which contains TonUINO data, the data will be read and displayed.
Existing data on the tag will be overwritten.
Right now, only Tonuino 2.0.1 Tags are fully supported. Arbitrary data may be entered via the \'Extended\' or \'Bytes\' tabs.
Please enter a number between %d and %d.

string-array.name: edit_mode_description
string-array.item: A random file from the chosen folder will be played.
Plays all files inside the folder in numerical order.
Plays random files inside the folder.
Plays only the chosen file from the selected folder.
Plays all files inside the folder in numerical order and keeps track of the last started file. This way the tag will play where it left off the last time.
Tonuino 2.0.1 does not yet support admin tags.

string-array.name: edit_modifier_tags_description
string-array.item: Randomly pauses the track after 5 to 30 seconds
All buttons are locked and no new card will be read
Previous and back buttons are locked. Adding a new card will not stop the current track but will schedule it as next track
Will e.g. tell volume before changing it

resources.string: Cannot write data without a tag
To increase the chances that the data will be successfully written, place the device directly on top of the tag and then press the button to write.
This view allows to select values for the NFC tag.
This extended view can be used to enter values for TonUINO variants that this app does not know about.
This view can be used to enter arbitrary data.
The first four byte are used by TonUINO to recognize a usable tag. This cookie must also be the same in the TonUINO source code. Otherwise the tag will not work.
This app will always write full sectors (size depends on tag). The rest of the sector will be filled with \'0x0\'.
